comments.body:
Isn't the default /bin/sh anymore ?

What happens when make_become_cmd is executed with executable=None ?
defaults to self.executable, which gets set from inventory or if all else fails the old DEFAULT_EXECUTABLE, which is `/bin/sh` by default
the reason i left as `None` in the test is that it is called with `None` but does not result in it (diff test needed for that)
I understand, pretty cool, I guess that's the kind of things that makes ansible work all the time, thanks a heap B)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +628,632 @@            play_context.remote_user = 'root'
            action_base._low_level_execute_command('ECHO SAME', sudoable=True)
            play_context.make_become_cmd.assert_called_once_with("ECHO SAME", executable=None)
        finally:
            C.BECOME_ALLOW_SAME_USER = become_allow_same_user
